item.title: From fold to parsers
item.description: .language-haskell { color: #fff!important; } .builtin { color: #fff!important; } .string { color: #fff!important; } Introduction Folds are fundamental building blocks of functional programming. Every main function can more-or-less be represented by a fold. In this article we’ll see how parsers are a simple extension to folds. We’ll start with foldl and evolve it into a parser.
